subtitle: Good on their own, or serve as an unusual vegetable accompaniment. A great way to use leftover cookd parsnips and potatoes.

method.text: Boil the vegetables in a pan of lightly salted boiling water for 15 min or until tender. Drain well. Return to hot pan. Mash with butter and seasoning. Leave to cool.
Beat in the egg. Stir in the cheese. Divide into cakes (2 per serving).
Heat the butter and oil in a frying pan. Fry cakes gently for 8-10 min, turning once, until crispy and golden brown. Drain on kitchen paper. Serve.

title: Cheese, parsnip and potato cakes
